intro: Pouzolzia procridioides var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pouzolzia, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
